meanings.definition: To live or spend time in the countryside
meanings.sent1: During the summer break, my family and I rusticated in a cozy cabin near the forest.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy rusticated weekends away from the city to relax in nature.
meanings.sent3: The city dweller decided to rusticate for a week, but quickly missed the hustle and bustle.
meanings.sent4: The idea of rusticated life seemed like a dream until the reality of no Wi-Fi set in.
meanings.sent5: She found peace and tranquility when she rusticated in the serene countryside.

meanings.definition: To give a rustic appearance to a building
meanings.sent1: The architect rusticated the exterior walls of the house to match the natural surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse was rusticated with wooden beams and stone walls for a charming look.
meanings.sent3: The modern building looked out of place until it was rusticated to blend in with the village.
meanings.sent4: The castle's walls were rusticated to give it a timeless and majestic appearance.
meanings.sent5: The artist's touch rusticated the plain structure into a work of art.

meanings.definition: To suspend a student from a university as a punishment
meanings.sent1: The university decided to rusticate the student for breaking the code of conduct.
meanings.sent2: Being rusticated from the university was a harsh consequence for his actions.
meanings.sent3: The student regretted his actions when he was rusticated and had to return home.
meanings.sent4: Rusticating the student served as a warning to others about the consequences of misbehavior.
meanings.sent5: The student's parents were disappointed when they heard he was rusticated from his studies.
